artist: Artist: Kitagawa Utamaro; Publisher: Tsutaya Jūzaburō
inscription: {Naniwaya chō chaya ni yasuraite / Naniwazu no / na ni ou mono wa / yukikai ni / ashi no tomara nu / hito mo arashina} (As Naniwa bay is famous for being thick with reeds, / the teahouse sharing the same name is famous for / being crowded with customers / who come around / and can\'r help stopping by.)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Okita was a beautiful waitress at the Naniwaya tea-house near Asakusa Temple in the city of Edo. When Utamaro created this print of her, she would have been about fifteen years old. Utamaro also included a cartouche in the shape of a poem card in the upper left portion of the print with a poem by Katsura-no-Mayuzumi that further attests to the allure of Okita: Resting at the tea-house in Naniwaya district, Myriad as the reeds of Naniwa Bay Art those who come running at the name of this shop Each passerby has to stop.
title: Naniwaya Teahouse Waitress Okita
